name: Storm Clouds Up Ahead CD
description: 4 Track Demo/EP: Havana’s Aggression Heaven Falls Saqqara and Memphis Darkside Of Atum ROCKBEAST CD REVIEW: “Less than a year spent as a full band and London dwelling Dante’s Ascension truly serve up impressive, heavy slabs of hardcore metal; not quite in the vein of Hatebreed but in a more individualistic crossover sort of way. Debut EP, ‘Storm Clouds Up Ahead’ opens with the furious, chug monster that is ‘Havana’s Aggression’, with Ricky’s vocals falling somewhere between Lamb Of God’s Randy Blythe and Nostromo’s Javier. Being heavy and abrasive isn’t the only dynamic DA are utilising though with the aforementioned track and ‘Darkside Of Atum’ being the apogee of their craft, ambient chord progressions and soaring clean vocal melodies ignite a passion apparent in their sound that most bands of their breed just simply fail to depict; even most of this band’s peers arguably don’t sound this interesting. For a first effort, this is striking stuff and with some nurturing of their apparent ambition, drive and creativity they could be taking the scene to new heights. Review by Lee Macbride ‘Storm Clouds Up Ahead’ is OUT NOW through myspace.com/dantesascension”
